Description of incident: A backup tape was stolen in                Ohio in June and contained data removed by Accenture from the state's                Core-CT computer system, which performs all of the state's payroll,                personnel, purchasing, accounting and inventory functions. The backup                tape contained state agency bank account numbers, bank names and                types of accounts, as well as the names and Social Security numbers                of 58 of Connecticut taxpayers. Connecticut officials today revealed                plans to file a civil complaint against IT consulting giant Accenture                Ltd. related to this security breach involving stolen records tied                to state agency bank accounts worth millions of dollars.
